page.title: HP Pavilion TX1000 Series Tablet PC

rev.diff:

{{article issues|cleanup=September 2009|copyedit=September 2009|prose=September 2009|unreferenced=September 2009}}
{{article issues|cleanup=September 2009|copyedit=September 2009|prose=September 2009|unreferenced=September 2009}}
'''HP Pavilion TX1000 Series Tablet PC''' is a series of [[Laptop|notebook]] computers from [[Hewlett Packard]] introduced in February 2007. These notebooks are designed for [[Windows Vista]]. The tx series uses the AMD Turion 64 X2 processors. This series has a 12.1" touch screen, a DVD+RW and competed well with the top of the line tablets at the time of release. All models came with a NVIDIA GeForce Go 6150 graphics system, which features 128mb integrated graphics and extra shared graphics memory of up to 916mb.

All models came with a NVIDIA GeForce Go 6150 graphics system, which features 128mb integrated graphics and extra shared graphics memory of up to 916mb.
